title: Stacey Solomon says she would take legal action against Coleen Rooney as WAG war rages on
text:

Loose Women panelist Stacey Solomon has claimed that if she was Rebekah Vardy, she would take legal action against Coleen Rooney.

Coleen rocked the nation with her sensational claims that Rebekah had been leaking stories to the press about her.

On her Twitter account, she revealed she had planted false stories about herself on her Instagram , slowly changing her settings so that fewer and fewer people could see them.

By the end of her months long investigation, the stories were still being leaked to the press even though only one person was able to see them on Coleen's story.

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

This person, Coleen dramatically revealed, was Rebekah Vardy, wife of footballer Jamie Vardy and a good friend of Coleen's.

Appearing on Loose Women today, Stacey revealed she was confused by the whole row.

"I understand why [Coleen] would be really upset and really hurt and want to out that person.

"But I think unless you have a conversation with somebody you can't get a real gist of whether they've have done it or not.

"She hasn't actually outed Rebekah Vardy, she said Rebekah Vardy's account, which leaves it open to anything."

"What do you achieve with that? I don't really understand."

(Image: Twitter)

Rebekah hit back at the claims saying she "doesn't need the money" and slamming Coleen for causing her stress when she is heavily pregnant.

In an interview with the Daily Mail , she claimed arguing with Coleen was like "arguing with a pigeon".

Stacey revealed she didn't agree with Rebekah's course of action either, and believes she should have ignored Coleen's claims.

She said: "But then I don't get Rebekah Vardy's side either because if I was Rebekah and I knew I had done nothing and felt like someone had put it out there for me, I wouldn't even reply, I would just send a lawyer's letter."

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: Dave J Hogan/Getty Images)

In a blistering statement, Becky accused other people of accessing her Instagram and said she was "disgusted" by Coleen's allegations.

The pregnant I'm A Celebrity star wrote: "As I have just said to you on the phone, I wish you had called me if you thought this.

"I never speak to anyone about you as various journalists who have asked me to over the years can vouch for.

"Over the years various people have had access to my insta & just this week I found I was following people I didn't know and have never followed myself.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

"I'm not being funny but I don't need the money, what would I gain from selling stories on you?

"I liked you a lot Coleen & I'm so upset that you have chosen to do this, especially when I'm heavily pregnant.

"I'm disgusted that I'm even having to deny this. You should have called me the first time this happened."

Becky added a broken heart emoji to the bottom of her statement.
description: The Loose Women star has criticised both parties' behaviour in the furious spat between Coleen and Rebekah
